pageContext.claim: “You know [student loans were] set up by President Obama as a subsidy for Obamacare, and which a lot of people don't understand, and it turns out to be a disaster. There's a tremendous default rate, and we're going to be doing something on it.”
pageContext.analysis: Clare McCann, deputy director for higher-education policy at New America, told The Chronicle for Higher Education in 2017, “In a very technical sense, I suppose you could argue that the savings from the direct-loan switch helped to pay for some of the costs of Obamacare.” However, McCann continued “you would be hard-pressed to say that the switch from federally guaranteed loans to federally administered loans affected the control the federal government had in any real way.”
